results.title: Ironbark Bill (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Philip Pepper, Don Ezard and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: This animated tale tells a raunchy, rocky, hilarious story of the legendary Ironbark Bill and the Champion Buckjumper, a high-spirited horse who bounces so high in his bucking that rider and horse end up in the clouds. The problem, then, is how to get down. It is based on Australian writer, Dal Stivens’ “Ironbark Bill” tall tales.

results.title: Iron shoes and granite tracks
results.creator_credit: Ted Davis and Victorian Railways Board
results.brief_description: Preparing for the summer season at the Mount Buffalo Chalet is a busy time. The ponies are brought up from the valley below where they had been on agistment during the winter. The stables are made ready and the riding gear dusted and cleaned in readiness for the visitors. Horse riding through the scenic countryside of Mount Buffalo is a popular holiday recreation.

results.title: Iron ore
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A survey of the mining, transporting and use of iron ore in the steel industry at Whyalla and Port Kembla. Indicates the various unused deposits of iron ore, especially in Western Australia.

results.title: Iron Island
results.creator_credit: R.H. Miller and Southern Cross Films
results.brief_description: The winning of iron ore from the earth at Cockatoo Island on Yampi Sound (Western Australia). Recalls the history of the region mentioning the importance of the pearling industry in the earlier part of the century. Shows the amenities provided for the residents of Cockatoo Island; views the extraction of the iron ore; transportation by trucks and conveyor belts to primary and secondary crushing plants; loading of the ore on to ships.

results.title: Iron in Australia
results.brief_description: An instructional film surveying the iron industry in Australia. Shows the mining of iron ore; the processing procedure, using explanatory animated drawings; and the manufacture of iron and steel products. Includes a brief history of the industry in Australia. Commentary by Roger Climpson.
results.description: An instructional film surveying the iron industry in Australia. results.title: Iron Chef
results.brief_description: Iron Chef is a Japanese television cooking show produced by Fuji Television. The series, which premiered on October 10, 1993, is a stylized cook-off featuring guest chefs challenging one of the show’s resident “Iron Chefs” in a timed cooking battle built around a specific theme ingredient. The series ended on September 24, 1999, although occasional specials were produced until 2002. The series aired 309 episodes. Repeats are regularly aired on the Cooking Channel in the United States and on Special Broadcasting Service in Australia. Fuji TV will air a new version of the show, titled Iron Chef, beginning in October 26, 2012.

results.title: Irma Vep
results.creator_credit: Olivier Assayas, Georges Benayoun and Dacia Films
results.brief_description: Irma Vep is a charming comedy about the art of filmmaking. When Hong Kong movie star Maggie (Maggie Cheung playing herself) comes to make a film in Paris with French director Rene Vidal(Jean-Pierre Leaud) she has little idea of the maelstrom she is entering. Despite the stresses of being in a strange city with a minimum grasp of the French language, Maggie implicitly believes in her director’s vision. His long-suffering crew, however, do not and when Rene is overcome with the symptoms of a nervous breakdown it seems the film is set for a disasterous outcome. Despite this, “Irma Vep” ends on a magical note as the mysterious director manages to create his vision despite the circumstances of the film-making process. In this fun ‘mockumentary’ Oliver Assayas cryptically comments on the art of filmmaking as well as on the French film industry (and the Hong Kong film phenomenon). Ultimately “Irma Vep” is a vehicle for and a tribute to Hong Kong movie star Maggie Cheung, whose brave performance grounds the whole film. In English and French with English subtitles.
